evidence.name: Note from Houston
evidence.content: *Good luck, astronaut. We pray you don't need it.*

evidence.name: NES Controller
evidence.content: The designers of this rocket each put something on it that was important to them. This was a rule made by NASA to ensure that the designers wouldn't let it fail. There were pictures, wedding rings, etc, but this controller stood out.

puzzles.name: Thruster Engage Lever
puzzles.content: Something is preventing the lever from moving all the way. When you look closer, a tab labeled *Remove in case of emergencies* is visible. The tab has a locking mechanism that can be unlocked with a 4 digit code.
puzzles.shortdesc: The lever is getting stuck. Requires a 4 digit code.

evidence.name: Potted Plant
evidence.content: A potted plant with a flower in it. There's a note on the bottom that reads, *Water Twice a day*.

puzzles.name: Broken Computer
puzzles.content: The power revealed a computer that when turned on, displayed *Hard Drive Error (Bad Sector - 24)*.
puzzles.shortdesc: Broken computer with a corrupted hard drive

evidence.name: Damaged Fuel Cell
evidence.content: The fuel cell is bulging, and it's clear that whatever went wrong started with this.

puzzles.name: Backup Generator
puzzles.content: The analysis lab requires power. The generator needs to be jumpstarted by inputting a specific sequence of movements and button presses. 1 is up, 2 is down, 3 is left, 4 is right. There are two buttons: a and b.
puzzles.shortdesc: Move it in a specific way to activate.

puzzles.name: Console
puzzles.content: After turning on the power, a screen whirred to life. It displays: *NASA In-house monitor & log console v0.0.1 - Password required*
